content: By: Russ Jones June 26, 2017 Paint by Numbers: Using Data to Produce Great Content Content Marketing | SEO Basics | Blogging It happens to the best of us. Sometimes it is hard to find that inspiration for writing even though we feel a drive to produce more and better content to push marketing numbers. Sometimes we should stand back and let the numbers do the writing for us. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin May 19, 2017 Blog Post Ideas: Maximize Your Reach with the Right Topics Whiteboard Friday | Blogging A blog is only as effective as its posts. In this Whiteboard Friday, Rand offers six paths you can take to make sure your posts resonate with your audiences. Read this post By: Sean Martin February 16, 2017 How We Increased Our Email Response Rate from ~8% to 34% Email Marketing | SEO Basics | Blogging Are you wasting time with inefficient outreach emails that get ignored? By testing three tweaks to an existing template, the folks at Directive Consulting were able to more than triple their reply rate and win more guest posting opportunities. Read this post By: Felicia Crawford October 11, 2016 We Fought the Comment Spam (and the Comment Spam Didn't Win) Blogging When we noticed that comment quality was rapidly declining on the blog, we decided to do something about it. And that something didn't involve closing comments, but improving them. Read this post By: Larry Kim October 4, 2016 SEO Trek: The Search for Google RankBrain* [New Data] Keyword Research | Advanced SEO | Blogging Engagement is a huge but often ignored opportunity, and may be an important aspect of Google's machine learning algorithms. Larry Kim shares new findings to support the theory that these algorithms reward high user engagement. Read this post By: Ronell Smith September 8, 2016 Why Content Marketing's Future Depends on Shorter Content and Less Content Content Marketing | Blogging Brands hoping to find lasting, consistent success at content marketing should adopt a "shorter content/less content" mindset. Read this post By: Jeremy Durant June 14, 2016 Why We Only Accept 1 Out of Every 10 Guest Blog Pitches Blogging Pitching a guest post on hoverboards to a B2B marketing blog is, unsurprisingly, a bad idea. Find out why Bop Design rejects 9 out of every 10 pitches and what you can do to increase your own chances of pitching success. Read this post By: Katy Katz June 13, 2016 Here’s How to Visually Map a Content Strategy Content Marketing | Blogging When it comes to building a content strategy to guide your brand, seeing is believing, so creating a visual roadmap can help mightily. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin June 3, 2016 SEO for Bloggers: How to Nail the Optimization Process for Your Posts On-page SEO | Whiteboard Friday | Blogging With the right process and a dose of patience, SEO success is always within reach — even if you're running your own blog. Optimizing your blog posts begins as early as the inception of your idea, and from then on you'll want to consider your keyword targeting, on-page factors, your intended audience, and more. In this Whiteboard Friday, Rand spells out a step-by-step process you can adopt to help increase search traffic to your blog over time. Read this post By: Serge Stefoglo May 2, 2016 The Start-to-Finish Guide to Optimizing Your WordPress Blog Posts [Plus a Checklist] SEO Basics | Blogging Sooner or later, you'll be faced with using WordPress to create blog posts. Sergey Stefoglo goes through the ins and outs of uploading and optimizing posts with the Yoast SEO plugin for WordPress, offering a downloadable checklist to help make sure you've hit all the marks. Read this post By: Ronell Smith April 13, 2016 3 Tactics That'll Make Writing Tighter as Easy as 1-2-3 Content Marketing | Blogging If you're serious about readers seeing the strength of your ideas, writing shorter content must become a part of your repertoire. Read this post By: Katy Katz April 5, 2016 How to Steal from Your Favorite Writers to Make Your Copy Sing Content Marketing | Blogging | SEO Copywriting How often do you sit down to read a book and find yourself hooked within the first few sentences? Or even the first few words? I would venture to bet the answer is "not often."In fact, I find that the books which turn out to be my favorite in the end typically take at least 50-100 pages to “pick up pace.” But we expect that when we read a good book. We come to the table knowing what... Read this post By: Simon Penson March 24, 2016 The Brand as Publisher Masterplan - Reinventing Content Marketing for the Next Decade Content Marketing | Blogging | Public Relations Content marketing is big business, but are brands taking it far enough? Here Simon Penson argues that Brand as Publisher is the next step. Read this post By: Ronell Smith March 23, 2016 How to Create Content That Earns Engagement, Trust, and Loyalty for Your Brand Content Marketing | SEO Basics | Blogging Content is meant to support your marketing efforts; it shouldn't define them. Ronell Smith talks about the goals you shouldn't be setting for your content marketing efforts, the ones you should focus on, and the best ways to get started on the road to brand loyalty.
